headline: Why Was the Market Down Today?
summary: Technology stocks were driving market benchmarks lower Thursday, but many sectors and stocks were spared from the downturn.  Microsoft was the biggest reason U.S. stocks were down.  Microsoft fell 10% after investors raised worries about the company's cloud-business revenue.

raw.headline: Why Was the Market Down Today?

headline: Why Is the Market Down Today?
summary: Technology stocks are driving market benchmarks lower Thursday, but many sectors and stocks have been spared from the downturn.  Microsoft is the biggest reason U.S. stocks are down at the moment.  This afternoon, Microsoft is down 12% after investors raised worries about the company's cloud-business revenue.

raw.headline: Why Is the Market Down Today?

Microsoft is the biggest reason U.S. stocks are down at the moment.  This afternoon, Microsoft is down 12% after investors raised worries about the company's cloud-business revenue.

headline: Friday's big stock stories: What’s likely to move the market in the next trading session
summary: The S&P 500 fell Thursday, dragged down by a slide in Microsoft. Software stocks also sold off, fueled by fears that AI could threaten those businesses.

raw.headline: Friday's big stock stories: What’s likely to move the market in the next trading session
raw.summary: The S&P 500 fell Thursday, dragged down by a slide in Microsoft. Software stocks also sold off, fueled by fears that AI could threaten those businesses.

headline: US software stocks slide after SAP, ServiceNow results fuel AI disruption fears
summary: U.S. software stocks fell on Thursday after SAP's cautious cloud outlook and a post-earnings drop in ServiceNow ​shares reinforced investor concerns about mounting competition from artificial intelligence-related ‌companies.  ServiceNow dropped 9.6% despite forecasting annual subscription revenue above Wall Street estimates.  The double-whammy dragged Salesforce shares down 5.6%, while Photoshop maker Adobe and ‍cloud security firm Datadog fell 3.1% each.

headline: Software stocks fall premarket as Microsoft and SAP results weigh
summary: Investing.com -- Software shares fell sharply in premarket U.S. trading Thursday after updates from Microsoft and SAP raised fresh questions about the durability of cloud and AI spending.
